meta.methodology: Crawled 12 modern fashion/lifestyle e-commerce storefronts + 4 high-motion agency/portfolio sites via Firecrawl MCP. Extracted branding, layouts, animation patterns, and typography from live sites.

sites.name: Allbirds
sites.reason_for_pick: Best-in-class sustainable footwear brand with an earthy, nature-inspired palette and elegant product cards; excellent balance of whitespace and content density.
sites.why: Earthy neutral palette with generous whitespace; rounded pill-shaped CTAs create warmth; product grid uses clean card layout with hover color swatches.

sites.name: Reformation
sites.reason_for_pick: Leading sustainable fashion brand with editorial typography, sharp geometric UI, and strong photographic hero sections.
sites.why: Deep red accent on white creates high-end editorial feel; sharp geometric buttons signal confidence; large product imagery drives conversion.

sites.name: Alo Yoga
sites.reason_for_pick: Premium athleisure brand with a monochrome palette, full-bleed hero imagery, and smooth page transitions typical of headless Shopify builds.
sites.why: Monochrome black/white palette lets product photography dominate; minimal UI noise maximizes visual impact of activewear imagery.

sites.name: SKIMS
sites.reason_for_pick: Celebrity-backed shapewear brand with skin-tone-driven palette, mobile-first design, and rich product detail pages.
sites.why: Uses skin-tone palette to create emotional connection; mobile-optimized app extends the design system; streamlined product pages focus on conversion.

sites.name: Mejuri
sites.reason_for_pick: Luxury jewelry brand that translates premium feel to digital with generous whitespace, delicate animations, and consistent across-channel experience.
sites.why: Gold-on-white palette signals luxury without being heavy; hover image-swap on product cards drives engagement; masonry grid adds visual variety.

sites.name: Aura Bora
sites.reason_for_pick: Vibrant sparkling water brand with bold illustrations, playful animations, and a standout custom identity.
sites.why: Bold custom illustration style makes brand memorable; animated elements add playfulness without hurting load times; color-coded product cards improve scannability.

sites.name: Cambridge Satchel
sites.reason_for_pick: Heritage leather goods brand with classic British aesthetic, rich photography, and interactive product customizer.
sites.why: Rich leather-tone palette reinforces brand heritage; product configurator increases engagement time; clean grid layout with clear visual hierarchy.

sites.name: Vacation Inc
sites.reason_for_pick: Retro-inspired suncare brand with nostalgic design, whimsical animations, and standout visual identity.
sites.why: Retro design evokes emotional nostalgia; parallax hero layers create depth; floating product images with shadows feel tactile and premium.

sites.name: Represent
sites.reason_for_pick: Contemporary streetwear brand with luxurious imagery, minimal layout, and editorial-quality photography.
sites.why: Dark/neutral palette lets product photography shine; large-format images create premium editorial feel; scroll-triggered reveals add engagement.

sites.name: Britive
sites.reason_for_pick: Award-winning GSAP-animated site with smooth scroll-triggered animations, 3D elements, and interactive storytelling.
sites.why: Exemplifies best GSAP patterns: scroll-triggered section reveals, clip-path text animations, and subtle parallax that adds depth without distraction.

sites.name: Cosmos Studio
sites.reason_for_pick: Award-winning design agency site with GSAP-powered scroll animations, smooth transitions, and immersive 3D interactions.
sites.why: Demonstrates production-quality GSAP timeline orchestration: staggered text entries, batch-triggered reveals, and smooth inter-page transitions.

sites.name: Bella
sites.reason_for_pick: Beauty/lifestyle brand with clean GSAP animations, horizontal scroll sections, and micro-interaction hover states.
sites.why: Shows how to apply GSAP patterns specifically to product-focused sites: horizontal scroll showcases, card hover parallax, and subtle breathing loops that add life.

top_patterns.name: Split Hero (Left Text / Right Model)
top_patterns.description: Hero section divided into two columns: left contains headline, subtext, and CTA; right contains a full-height model or product image, often with transparent background for layering effects.
top_patterns.cara_applicability: High — current Cara hero uses background image with overlaid text; upgrade to split layout with model cutout adds visual hierarchy.

top_patterns.name: Staggered Product Grid Reveal
top_patterns.description: Product cards enter viewport with a staggered delay using ScrollTrigger.batch(), creating a cascade effect as user scrolls.
top_patterns.cara_applicability: High — directly applicable to both Featured Products and New Arrivals grids.

top_patterns.name: Mask/Clip-Path Headline Reveal
top_patterns.description: Hero headline text reveals via clip-path or mask animation, typically left-to-right or bottom-to-top, creating a dramatic entrance.
top_patterns.cara_applicability: High — apply to hero title lines with staggered delay for premium entrance.

top_patterns.name: Product Card Hover Image Swap
top_patterns.description: Product card shows an alternate angle or lifestyle shot on hover, smoothly crossfading between the two images.
top_patterns.cara_applicability: Medium — enhances product discovery; requires alternate product images.

top_patterns.name: Hero Breathing Loop
top_patterns.description: Subtle Y-axis oscillation on hero model/image creating a live, breathing effect using GSAP yoyo repeat(-1) with sine easing.
top_patterns.cara_applicability: High — adds life to hero model cutout without adding complexity.

top_patterns.name: Multi-Layer Parallax Hero
top_patterns.description: Hero section composed of multiple layers (background, midground model, foreground accents) that move at different scroll speeds.
top_patterns.cara_applicability: Medium — visually impressive but requires layered assets from Stitch.

top_patterns.name: Clip-Path Promo Banner Reveal
top_patterns.description: Promo banner content reveals through expanding clip-path (circle or polygon) creating a dramatic reveal as section enters viewport.
top_patterns.cara_applicability: High — directly applicable to Cara's promo banner and 70% off section.

top_patterns.name: Micro-Parallax Inside Product Cards
top_patterns.description: Product image within card shifts subtly based on mouse position, creating a 3D hover depth effect without actual 3D rendering.
top_patterns.cara_applicability: High — lightweight effect that adds interactivity to product cards.

font_pairings.rationale: League Spartan's geometric boldness pairs perfectly with Inter's clean neutrality for body text. Inter has excellent readability at small sizes and harmonizes with League Spartan's x-height.
A serif pairing adds editorial sophistication. Source Serif 4's moderate contrast and open counters complement League Spartan's bold geometric forms for a fashion-editorial feel.
DM Sans offers a warmer, slightly rounded alternative to Inter for body text. Works well in fashion contexts where a softer, more approachable tone is desired.

color_accents.name: Ocean Teal
color_accents.usage: Keep as primary CTA and accent color — aligns with current Cara brand identity

color_accents.name: Warm Coral
color_accents.usage: Secondary accent for promotions, sale tags, and hover states — adds warmth to the teal-dominant palette
color_accents.source: Inspired by Aura Bora, Vacation Inc warm palettes

color_accents.name: Soft Cream
color_accents.usage: Card background and product plate color — creates warmth without stark white, inspired by Allbirds/SKIMS neutral backgrounds

cta_placement_rules: Primary CTA always above the fold, visible within 2 seconds of page load
Product card CTA (add-to-cart) positioned bottom-right with hover expansion
Secondary CTAs (Learn More, Explore) use ghost/outlined button style
Mobile: full-width sticky CTA bar on product detail pages
Banner CTAs centered below headline text with generous padding (16px+ vertical)

motion_techniques.purpose: Animate product cards in groups as they enter viewport, reducing individual trigger overhead
motion_techniques.perf_note: Use batch() instead of individual ScrollTriggers to minimize repaints

motion_techniques.purpose: Dramatic hero entrance using pre-rendered frame sequence from Stitch, animated via GSAP timeline
motion_techniques.perf_note: Use <canvas> rendering for frame sequences to avoid layout thrash; lazy-load frames

motion_techniques.purpose: Subtle Y-axis oscillation on hero model to add life; pauses when hero leaves viewport
motion_techniques.perf_note: Use will-change:transform; pause on ScrollTrigger leave to save GPU cycles

motion_techniques.purpose: Product card images shift subtly based on cursor position for 3D depth effect
motion_techniques.perf_note: Use quickTo for throttled updates; disable on touch devices

motion_techniques.purpose: Hero headline lines animate in with stagger, creating a cascading reveal
motion_techniques.perf_note: Respect prefers-reduced-motion: skip stagger, show immediately

motion_techniques.purpose: Native-feeling smooth scroll with momentum, integrated with GSAP ScrollTrigger via scrollerProxy
motion_techniques.perf_note: Lenis is lightweight (~5KB); use raf integration for GSAP sync

anti_patterns.why_avoid: Heavy bandwidth cost, LCP penalty, accessibility issues; use static hero with subtle GSAP animation instead
Breaks back-button, hampers SEO, causes layout shift; use paginated grid with load-more or SSG pages
Bundle size and GPU cost outweigh benefit for standard product views; reserve for interactive 360° only
